keyword: how many calories are in cookies
title: How Many Calories Are in Cookies?
meta_description: Learn how many calories are in cookies with a breakdown per standard chocolate chip cookie, including macros, fiber, and tips for variations.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Cookies?
assumptions: Standard medium chocolate chip cookie (~30 g), baked with butter, flour, sugar, and chocolate chips; no nuts or fillings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, brand, size, ingredients, and baking method. Check labels for specific products.

quick_answer.text: A typical medium chocolate chip cookie contains about 150 calories.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged cookies.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tbsp chopped nuts per cookie

faqs.q: How many calories are in one chocolate chip cookie?
faqs.a: About 150 kcal for a standard medium-sized cookie.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in cookies?
faqs.a: Typically 20 g carbs per cookie, mostly from flour and sugars.

faqs.q: Do cookies have a lot of fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 7 g total fat per cookie, with 3.5 g saturated.

faqs.q: How does cookie size affect calories?
faqs.a: Larger cookies can have 200+ kcal; smaller ones around 100 kcal.
Yes, options like reduced-sugar or oat-based can drop to 100-120 kcal per cookie.
